article.headline: Liberty 101, Cincinnati Christian 65
article.story: LYNCHBURG, Va. (AP) -- Larry Blair scored 27 points and Anthony Smith had 23 as Liberty pulled away in the second half Tuesday for a 101-65 win over Cincinnati Christian. Cincinnati Christian (4-4) led for most of the first half, but a steal, a lay-up and a free throw by Blair with 4:22 left until halftime put the Flames (1-1) ahead 36-34. Jake Santel scored on a tip-in for the Eagles a minute later to tie the game at 36-all. But Liberty went on a 8-2 run to close the half and take a 44-38 lead into the locker room. The second half wasn't nearly as close, with Liberty more than doubling Cincinnati Christian in scoring, 57-27. The Eagles shot just 31.7 percent for the game, while Liberty made 51.5 percent of its shots. Alex McLean added 15 points for the Flames. Justin Bilyeu and Joe Mendenhall each had 15 for Cincinnati Christian.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
